documentation: Amplify enables developers to develop and deploy cloud-powered mobile and web apps. The Amplify Console provides a continuous delivery and hosting service for web applications. For more information, see the Amplify Console User Guide. The Amplify Framework is a comprehensive set of SDKs, libraries, tools, and documentation for client app development. For more information, see the Amplify Framework.

CreateBackendEnvironment.documentation: Creates a new backend environment for an Amplify app.
CreateBackendEnvironment.name: CreateBackendEnvironment

CreateBranch.documentation: Creates a new branch for an Amplify app.
CreateBranch.name: CreateBranch

CreateDeployment.documentation: Creates a deployment for a manually deployed Amplify app. Manually deployed apps are not connected to a repository.
CreateDeployment.name: CreateDeployment

CreateDomainAssociation.documentation: Creates a new domain association for an Amplify app. This action associates a custom domain with the Amplify app
CreateDomainAssociation.name: CreateDomainAssociation

CreateWebhook.documentation: Creates a new webhook on an Amplify app.
CreateWebhook.name: CreateWebhook

DeleteApp.documentation: Deletes an existing Amplify app specified by an app ID.
DeleteApp.name: DeleteApp

DeleteBackendEnvironment.documentation: Deletes a backend environment for an Amplify app.
DeleteBackendEnvironment.name: DeleteBackendEnvironment

DeleteBranch.documentation: Deletes a branch for an Amplify app.
DeleteBranch.name: DeleteBranch

DeleteDomainAssociation.documentation: Deletes a domain association for an Amplify app.
DeleteDomainAssociation.name: DeleteDomainAssociation

DeleteJob.documentation: Deletes a job for a branch of an Amplify app.
DeleteJob.name: DeleteJob

GenerateAccessLogs.documentation: Returns the website access logs for a specific time range using a presigned URL.
GenerateAccessLogs.name: GenerateAccessLogs

GetApp.documentation: Returns an existing Amplify app by appID.
GetApp.name: GetApp

GetArtifactUrl.documentation: Returns the artifact info that corresponds to an artifact id.
GetArtifactUrl.name: GetArtifactUrl

GetBackendEnvironment.documentation: Returns a backend environment for an Amplify app.
GetBackendEnvironment.name: GetBackendEnvironment

GetBranch.documentation: Returns a branch for an Amplify app.
GetBranch.name: GetBranch

GetDomainAssociation.documentation: Returns the domain information for an Amplify app.
GetDomainAssociation.name: GetDomainAssociation

GetJob.documentation: Returns a job for a branch of an Amplify app.
GetJob.name: GetJob

GetWebhook.documentation: Returns the webhook information that corresponds to a specified webhook ID.
GetWebhook.name: GetWebhook

ListApps.documentation: Returns a list of the existing Amplify apps.
ListApps.name: ListApps

ListArtifacts.documentation: Returns a list of artifacts for a specified app, branch, and job.
ListArtifacts.name: ListArtifacts

ListBackendEnvironments.documentation: Lists the backend environments for an Amplify app.
ListBackendEnvironments.name: ListBackendEnvironments

ListBranches.documentation: Lists the branches of an Amplify app.
ListBranches.name: ListBranches

ListDomainAssociations.documentation: Returns the domain associations for an Amplify app.
ListDomainAssociations.name: ListDomainAssociations

ListJobs.documentation: Lists the jobs for a branch of an Amplify app.
ListJobs.name: ListJobs

ListTagsForResource.documentation: Returns a list of tags for a specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource

ListWebhooks.documentation: Returns a list of webhooks for an Amplify app.
ListWebhooks.name: ListWebhooks

StartDeployment.documentation: Starts a deployment for a manually deployed app. Manually deployed apps are not connected to a repository.
StartDeployment.name: StartDeployment

StartJob.documentation: Starts a new job for a branch of an Amplify app.
StartJob.name: StartJob

StopJob.documentation: Stops a job that is in progress for a branch of an Amplify app.
StopJob.name: StopJob

TagResource.documentation: Tags the resource with a tag key and value.
TagResource.name: TagResource

UntagResource.documentation: Untags a resource with a specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
UntagResource.name: UntagResource

UpdateBranch.documentation: Updates a branch for an Amplify app.
UpdateBranch.name: UpdateBranch

UpdateDomainAssociation.documentation: Creates a new domain association for an Amplify app.
UpdateDomainAssociation.name: UpdateDomainAssociation

App.documentation: Represents the different branches of a repository for building, deploying, and hosting an Amplify app.

appArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amplify app.

appId.documentation: The unique ID of the Amplify app.

autoBranchCreationConfig.documentation: Describes the automated branch creation configuration for the Amplify app.

autoBranchCreationPatterns.documentation: Describes the automated branch creation glob patterns for the Amplify app.

basicAuthCredentials.documentation: The basic authorization credentials for branches for the Amplify app. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

buildSpec.documentation: Describes the content of the build specification (build spec) for the Amplify app.

createTime.documentation: Creates a date and time for the Amplify app.

customHeaders.documentation: Describes the custom HTTP headers for the Amplify app.

customRules.documentation: Describes the custom redirect and rewrite rules for the Amplify app.

defaultDomain.documentation: The default domain for the Amplify app.

description.documentation: The description for the Amplify app.

enableAutoBranchCreation.documentation: Enables automated branch creation for the Amplify app.

enableBasicAuth.documentation: Enables basic authorization for the Amplify app's branches.

enableBranchAutoBuild.documentation: Enables the auto-building of branches for the Amplify app.

enableBranchAutoDeletion.documentation: Automatically disconnect a branch in the Amplify Console when you delete a branch from your Git repository.

environmentVariables.documentation: The environment variables for the Amplify app.

iamServiceRoleArn.documentation: The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service role for the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amplify app.

name.documentation: The name for the Amplify app.

platform.documentation: The platform for the Amplify app.

productionBranch.documentation: Describes the information about a production branch of the Amplify app.

repository.documentation: The Git repository for the Amplify app.

repositoryCloneMethod.documentation:
This is for internal use.

The Amplify service uses this parameter to specify the authentication protocol to use to access the Git repository for an Amplify app. Amplify specifies TOKEN for a GitHub repository, SIGV4 for an Amazon Web Services CodeCommit repository, and SSH for GitLab and Bitbucket repositories.

tags.documentation: The tag for the Amplify app.

updateTime.documentation: Updates the date and time for the Amplify app.

artifactFileName.documentation: The file name for the artifact.

artifactId.documentation: The unique ID for the artifact.

AutoBranchCreationConfig.documentation: Describes the automated branch creation configuration.

basicAuthCredentials.documentation: The basic authorization credentials for the autocreated branch. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

buildSpec.documentation: The build specification (build spec) for the autocreated branch.

enableAutoBuild.documentation: Enables auto building for the autocreated branch.

enableBasicAuth.documentation: Enables basic authorization for the autocreated branch.

enablePerformanceMode.documentation:
Enables performance mode for the branch.

Performance mode optimizes for faster hosting performance by keeping content cached at the edge for a longer interval. When performance mode is enabled, hosting configuration or code changes can take up to 10 minutes to roll out.

enablePullRequestPreview.documentation: Enables pull request previews for the autocreated branch.

environmentVariables.documentation: The environment variables for the autocreated branch.

framework.documentation: The framework for the autocreated branch.

pullRequestEnvironmentName.documentation: The Amplify environment name for the pull request.

stage.documentation: Describes the current stage for the autocreated branch.

BackendEnvironment.documentation: Describes the backend environment for an Amplify app.

backendEnvironmentArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a backend environment that is part of an Amplify app.

createTime.documentation: The creation date and time for a backend environment that is part of an Amplify app.

environmentName.documentation: The name for a backend environment that is part of an Amplify app.

stackName.documentation: The AWS CloudFormation stack name of a backend environment.

updateTime.documentation: The last updated date and time for a backend environment that is part of an Amplify app.

Branch.documentation: The branch for an Amplify app, which maps to a third-party repository branch.

activeJobId.documentation: The ID of the active job for a branch of an Amplify app.

associatedResources.documentation: A list of custom resources that are linked to this branch.

backendEnvironmentArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a backend environment that is part of an Amplify app.

basicAuthCredentials.documentation: The basic authorization credentials for a branch of an Amplify app. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

branchArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

branchName.documentation: The name for the branch that is part of an Amplify app.

buildSpec.documentation: The build specification (build spec) content for the branch of an Amplify app.

createTime.documentation: The creation date and time for a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

customDomains.documentation: The custom domains for a branch of an Amplify app.

description.documentation: The description for the branch that is part of an Amplify app.

destinationBranch.documentation: The destination branch if the branch is a pull request branch.

displayName.documentation: The display name for the branch. This is used as the default domain prefix.

enableAutoBuild.documentation: Enables auto-building on push for a branch of an Amplify app.

enableBasicAuth.documentation: Enables basic authorization for a branch of an Amplify app.

enableNotification.documentation: Enables notifications for a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

enablePerformanceMode.documentation:
Enables performance mode for the branch.

Performance mode optimizes for faster hosting performance by keeping content cached at the edge for a longer interval. When performance mode is enabled, hosting configuration or code changes can take up to 10 minutes to roll out.

enablePullRequestPreview.documentation: Enables pull request previews for the branch.

environmentVariables.documentation: The environment variables specific to a branch of an Amplify app.

framework.documentation: The framework for a branch of an Amplify app.

pullRequestEnvironmentName.documentation: The Amplify environment name for the pull request.

sourceBranch.documentation: The source branch if the branch is a pull request branch.

stage.documentation: The current stage for the branch that is part of an Amplify app.

tags.documentation: The tag for the branch of an Amplify app.

thumbnailUrl.documentation: The thumbnail URL for the branch of an Amplify app.

totalNumberOfJobs.documentation: The total number of jobs that are part of an Amplify app.

ttl.documentation: The content Time to Live (TTL) for the website in seconds.

updateTime.documentation: The last updated date and time for a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

BuildSpec.documentation: The build specification (build spec) file for an Amplify app build.

CreateAppRequest.documentation: The request structure used to create apps in Amplify.

accessToken.documentation:
The personal access token for a GitHub repository for an Amplify app. The personal access token is used to authorize access to a GitHub repository using the Amplify GitHub App. The token is not stored.

Use accessToken for GitHub repositories only. To authorize access to a repository provider such as Bitbucket or CodeCommit, use oauthToken.

You must specify either accessToken or oauthToken when you create a new app.

Existing Amplify apps deployed from a GitHub repository using OAuth continue to work with CI/CD. However, we strongly recommend that you migrate these apps to use the GitHub App. For more information, see Migrating an existing OAuth app to the Amplify GitHub App in the Amplify User Guide .

autoBranchCreationConfig.documentation: The automated branch creation configuration for an Amplify app.

autoBranchCreationPatterns.documentation: The automated branch creation glob patterns for an Amplify app.

basicAuthCredentials.documentation: The credentials for basic authorization for an Amplify app. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

buildSpec.documentation: The build specification (build spec) for an Amplify app.

customHeaders.documentation: The custom HTTP headers for an Amplify app.

customRules.documentation: The custom rewrite and redirect rules for an Amplify app.

description.documentation: The description for an Amplify app.

enableAutoBranchCreation.documentation: Enables automated branch creation for an Amplify app.

enableBasicAuth.documentation: Enables basic authorization for an Amplify app. This will apply to all branches that are part of this app.

enableBranchAutoBuild.documentation: Enables the auto building of branches for an Amplify app.

enableBranchAutoDeletion.documentation: Automatically disconnects a branch in the Amplify Console when you delete a branch from your Git repository.

environmentVariables.documentation: The environment variables map for an Amplify app.

iamServiceRoleArn.documentation: The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service role for an Amplify app.

name.documentation: The name for an Amplify app.

oauthToken.documentation:
The OAuth token for a third-party source control system for an Amplify app. The OAuth token is used to create a webhook and a read-only deploy key using SSH cloning. The OAuth token is not stored.

Use oauthToken for repository providers other than GitHub, such as Bitbucket or CodeCommit. To authorize access to GitHub as your repository provider, use accessToken.

You must specify either oauthToken or accessToken when you create a new app.

Existing Amplify apps deployed from a GitHub repository using OAuth continue to work with CI/CD. However, we strongly recommend that you migrate these apps to use the GitHub App. For more information, see Migrating an existing OAuth app to the Amplify GitHub App in the Amplify User Guide .

platform.documentation: The platform or framework for an Amplify app.

repository.documentation: The repository for an Amplify app.

tags.documentation: The tag for an Amplify app.

CreateBackendEnvironmentRequest.documentation: The request structure for the backend environment create request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

environmentName.documentation: The name for the backend environment.

stackName.documentation: The AWS CloudFormation stack name of a backend environment.

CreateBackendEnvironmentResult.documentation: The result structure for the create backend environment request.

backendEnvironment.documentation: Describes the backend environment for an Amplify app.

CreateBranchRequest.documentation: The request structure for the create branch request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

backendEnvironmentArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a backend environment that is part of an Amplify app.

basicAuthCredentials.documentation: The basic authorization credentials for the branch. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

buildSpec.documentation: The build specification (build spec) for the branch.

displayName.documentation: The display name for a branch. This is used as the default domain prefix.

enableAutoBuild.documentation: Enables auto building for the branch.

enableBasicAuth.documentation: Enables basic authorization for the branch.

enablePerformanceMode.documentation:
Enables performance mode for the branch.

Performance mode optimizes for faster hosting performance by keeping content cached at the edge for a longer interval. When performance mode is enabled, hosting configuration or code changes can take up to 10 minutes to roll out.

enablePullRequestPreview.documentation: Enables pull request previews for this branch.

environmentVariables.documentation: The environment variables for the branch.

pullRequestEnvironmentName.documentation: The Amplify environment name for the pull request.

stage.documentation: Describes the current stage for the branch.

ttl.documentation: The content Time To Live (TTL) for the website in seconds.

CreateBranchResult.documentation: The result structure for create branch request.

branch.documentation: Describes the branch for an Amplify app, which maps to a third-party repository branch.

CreateDeploymentRequest.documentation: The request structure for the create a new deployment request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.documentation: The name for the branch, for the job.

fileMap.documentation: An optional file map that contains the file name as the key and the file content md5 hash as the value. If this argument is provided, the service will generate a unique upload URL per file. Otherwise, the service will only generate a single upload URL for the zipped files.

CreateDeploymentResult.documentation: The result structure for the create a new deployment request.

fileUploadUrls.documentation: When the fileMap argument is provided in the request, fileUploadUrls will contain a map of file names to upload URLs.

jobId.documentation: The job ID for this deployment. will supply to start deployment api.

zipUploadUrl.documentation: When the fileMap argument is not provided in the request, this zipUploadUrl is returned.

CreateDomainAssociationRequest.documentation: The request structure for the create domain association request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

autoSubDomainCreationPatterns.documentation: Sets the branch patterns for automatic subdomain creation.

autoSubDomainIAMRole.documentation: The required AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service role for the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for automatically creating subdomains.

domainName.documentation: The domain name for the domain association.

enableAutoSubDomain.documentation: Enables the automated creation of subdomains for branches.

CreateDomainAssociationResult.documentation: The result structure for the create domain association request.

domainAssociation.documentation: Describes the structure of a domain association, which associates a custom domain with an Amplify app.

CreateWebhookRequest.documentation: The request structure for the create webhook request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.documentation: The name for a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

CreateWebhookResult.documentation: The result structure for the create webhook request.

webhook.documentation: Describes a webhook that connects repository events to an Amplify app.

CustomRule.documentation: Describes a custom rewrite or redirect rule.

condition.documentation: The condition for a URL rewrite or redirect rule, such as a country code.

source.documentation: The source pattern for a URL rewrite or redirect rule.

status.documentation:
The status code for a URL rewrite or redirect rule.

200

Represents a 200 rewrite rule.

301

Represents a 301 (moved pemanently) redirect rule. This and all future requests should be directed to the target URL.

302

Represents a 302 temporary redirect rule.

404

Represents a 404 redirect rule.

404-200

Represents a 404 rewrite rule.

target.documentation: The target pattern for a URL rewrite or redirect rule.

DeleteAppRequest.documentation: Describes the request structure for the delete app request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

DeleteAppResult.documentation: The result structure for the delete app request.

DeleteBackendEnvironmentRequest.documentation: The request structure for the delete backend environment request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID of an Amplify app.

environmentName.documentation: The name of a backend environment of an Amplify app.

DeleteBackendEnvironmentResult.documentation: The result structure of the delete backend environment result.

backendEnvironment.documentation: Describes the backend environment for an Amplify app.

DeleteBranchRequest.documentation: The request structure for the delete branch request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

DeleteBranchResult.documentation: The result structure for the delete branch request.

branch.documentation: The branch for an Amplify app, which maps to a third-party repository branch.

DeleteDomainAssociationRequest.documentation: The request structure for the delete domain association request.

appId.documentation: The unique id for an Amplify app.

DeleteJobRequest.documentation: The request structure for the delete job request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.documentation: The name for the branch, for the job.

jobId.documentation: The unique ID for the job.

DeleteJobResult.documentation: The result structure for the delete job request.

DeleteWebhookRequest.documentation: The request structure for the delete webhook request.

webhookId.documentation: The unique ID for a webhook.

DeleteWebhookResult.documentation: The result structure for the delete webhook request.

webhook.documentation: Describes a webhook that connects repository events to an Amplify app.

DependentServiceFailureException.documentation: An operation failed because a dependent service threw an exception.

DomainAssociation.documentation: Describes a domain association that associates a custom domain with an Amplify app.

autoSubDomainCreationPatterns.documentation: Sets branch patterns for automatic subdomain creation.

autoSubDomainIAMRole.documentation: The required AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service role for the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for automatically creating subdomains.

certificateVerificationDNSRecord.documentation: The DNS record for certificate verification.

domainAssociationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the domain association.

domainStatus.documentation: The current status of the domain association.

enableAutoSubDomain.documentation: Enables the automated creation of subdomains for branches.

statusReason.documentation: The reason for the current status of the domain association.

subDomains.documentation: The subdomains for the domain association.

GenerateAccessLogsRequest.documentation: The request structure for the generate access logs request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

endTime.documentation: The time at which the logs should end. The time range specified is inclusive of the end time.

startTime.documentation: The time at which the logs should start. The time range specified is inclusive of the start time.

GenerateAccessLogsResult.documentation: The result structure for the generate access logs request.

logUrl.documentation: The pre-signed URL for the requested access logs.

GetAppRequest.documentation: The request structure for the get app request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

GetArtifactUrlRequest.documentation: Returns the request structure for the get artifact request.

artifactId.documentation: The unique ID for an artifact.

GetArtifactUrlResult.documentation: Returns the result structure for the get artifact request.

artifactId.documentation: The unique ID for an artifact.

artifactUrl.documentation: The presigned URL for the artifact.

GetBackendEnvironmentRequest.documentation: The request structure for the get backend environment request.

appId.documentation: The unique id for an Amplify app.

environmentName.documentation: The name for the backend environment.

GetBackendEnvironmentResult.documentation: The result structure for the get backend environment result.

backendEnvironment.documentation: Describes the backend environment for an Amplify app.

GetBranchRequest.documentation: The request structure for the get branch request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

GetDomainAssociationRequest.documentation: The request structure for the get domain association request.

appId.documentation: The unique id for an Amplify app.

GetDomainAssociationResult.documentation: The result structure for the get domain association request.

domainAssociation.documentation: Describes the structure of a domain association, which associates a custom domain with an Amplify app.

GetJobRequest.documentation: The request structure for the get job request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.documentation: The branch name for the job.

jobId.documentation: The unique ID for the job.

GetWebhookRequest.documentation: The request structure for the get webhook request.

webhookId.documentation: The unique ID for a webhook.

GetWebhookResult.documentation: The result structure for the get webhook request.

webhook.documentation: Describes the structure of a webhook.

InternalFailureException.documentation: The service failed to perform an operation due to an internal issue.

Job.documentation: Describes an execution job for an Amplify app.

steps.documentation: The execution steps for an execution job, for an Amplify app.

summary.documentation: Describes the summary for an execution job for an Amplify app.

JobSummary.documentation: Describes the summary for an execution job for an Amplify app.

commitId.documentation: The commit ID from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitMessage.documentation: The commit message from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitTime.documentation: The commit date and time for the job.

endTime.documentation: The end date and time for the job.

jobArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the job.

jobId.documentation: The unique ID for the job.

jobType.documentation: The type for the job. If the value is RELEASE, the job was manually released from its source by using the StartJob API. If the value is RETRY, the job was manually retried using the StartJob API. If the value is WEB_HOOK, the job was automatically triggered by webhooks.

startTime.documentation: The start date and time for the job.

status.documentation: The current status for the job.

LimitExceededException.documentation: A resource could not be created because service quotas were exceeded.

ListAppsRequest.documentation: The request structure for the list apps request.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. If non-null, the pagination token is returned in a result. Pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

ListAppsResult.documentation: The result structure for an Amplify app list request.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing apps from start. If non-null, the pagination token is returned in a result. Pass its value in here to list more projects.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.documentation: The name of a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

jobId.documentation: The unique ID for a job.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing artifacts from start. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in here to list more artifacts.

ListArtifactsResult.documentation: The result structure for the list artifacts request.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

ListBackendEnvironmentsRequest.documentation: The request structure for the list backend environments request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

environmentName.documentation: The name of the backend environment

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing backend environments from the start. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in here to list more backend environments.

ListBackendEnvironmentsResult.documentation: The result structure for the list backend environments result.

backendEnvironments.documentation: The list of backend environments for an Amplify app.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

ListBranchesRequest.documentation: The request structure for the list branches request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing branches from the start. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in here to list more branches.

ListBranchesResult.documentation: The result structure for the list branches request.

branches.documentation: A list of branches for an Amplify app.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

ListDomainAssociationsRequest.documentation: The request structure for the list domain associations request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing apps from the start. If non-null, a pagination token is returned in a result. Pass its value in here to list more projects.

ListDomainAssociationsResult.documentation: The result structure for the list domain association request.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. If non-null, a pagination token is returned in a result. Pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

ListJobsRequest.documentation: The request structure for the list jobs request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing steps from the start. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in here to list more steps.

ListJobsResult.documentation: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

jobSummaries.documentation: The result structure for the list job result request.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. If non-null the pagination token is returned in a result. Pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

ListTagsForResourceRequest.documentation: The request structure to use to list tags for a resource.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use to list tags.

ListTagsForResourceResponse.documentation: The response for the list tags for resource request.

tags.documentation: A list of tags for the specified The Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

ListWebhooksRequest.documentation: The request structure for the list webhooks request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing webhooks from the start. If non-null,the pagination token is returned in a result. Pass its value in here to list more webhooks.

ListWebhooksResult.documentation: The result structure for the list webhooks request.

nextToken.documentation: A pagination token. If non-null, the pagination token is returned in a result. Pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

NotFoundException.documentation: An entity was not found during an operation.

ProductionBranch.documentation: Describes the information about a production branch for an Amplify app.

branchName.documentation: The branch name for the production branch.

lastDeployTime.documentation: The last deploy time of the production branch.

status.documentation: The status of the production branch.

thumbnailUrl.documentation: The thumbnail URL for the production branch.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: An operation failed due to a non-existent resource.

StartDeploymentRequest.documentation: The request structure for the start a deployment request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.documentation: The name for the branch, for the job.

jobId.documentation: The job ID for this deployment, generated by the create deployment request.

sourceUrl.documentation: The source URL for this deployment, used when calling start deployment without create deployment. The source URL can be any HTTP GET URL that is publicly accessible and downloads a single .zip file.

StartDeploymentResult.documentation: The result structure for the start a deployment request.

StartJobRequest.documentation: The request structure for the start job request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.documentation: The branch name for the job.

commitId.documentation: The commit ID from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitMessage.documentation: The commit message from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitTime.documentation: The commit date and time for the job.

jobId.documentation: The unique ID for an existing job. This is required if the value of jobType is RETRY.

jobReason.documentation: A descriptive reason for starting this job.

jobType.documentation: Describes the type for the job. The job type RELEASE starts a new job with the latest change from the specified branch. This value is available only for apps that are connected to a repository. The job type RETRY retries an existing job. If the job type value is RETRY, the jobId is also required.

StartJobResult.documentation: The result structure for the run job request.

Step.documentation: Describes an execution step, for an execution job, for an Amplify app.

artifactsUrl.documentation: The URL to the artifact for the execution step.

context.documentation: The context for the current step. Includes a build image if the step is build.

endTime.documentation: The end date and time of the execution step.

logUrl.documentation: The URL to the logs for the execution step.

screenshots.documentation: The list of screenshot URLs for the execution step, if relevant.

startTime.documentation: The start date and time of the execution step.

status.documentation: The status of the execution step.

statusReason.documentation: The reason for the current step status.

stepName.documentation: The name of the execution step.

testArtifactsUrl.documentation: The URL to the test artifact for the execution step.

testConfigUrl.documentation: The URL to the test configuration for the execution step.

StopJobRequest.documentation: The request structure for the stop job request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.documentation: The name for the branch, for the job.

jobId.documentation: The unique id for the job.

StopJobResult.documentation: The result structure for the stop job request.

SubDomain.documentation: The subdomain for the domain association.

dnsRecord.documentation: The DNS record for the subdomain.

subDomainSetting.documentation: Describes the settings for the subdomain.

verified.documentation: The verified status of the subdomain

SubDomainSetting.documentation: Describes the settings for the subdomain.

branchName.documentation: The branch name setting for the subdomain.

prefix.documentation: The prefix setting for the subdomain.

TTL.documentation: The content Time to Live (TTL) for the website in seconds.

TagResourceRequest.documentation: The request structure to tag a resource with a tag key and value.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use to tag a resource.

tags.documentation: The tags used to tag the resource.

TagResourceResponse.documentation: The response for the tag resource request.

UnauthorizedException.documentation: An operation failed due to a lack of access.

UntagResourceRequest.documentation: The request structure for the untag resource request.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use to untag a resource.

tagKeys.documentation: The tag keys to use to untag a resource.

UntagResourceResponse.documentation: The response for the untag resource request.

UpdateAppRequest.documentation: The request structure for the update app request.

accessToken.documentation:
The personal access token for a GitHub repository for an Amplify app. The personal access token is used to authorize access to a GitHub repository using the Amplify GitHub App. The token is not stored.

Use accessToken for GitHub repositories only. To authorize access to a repository provider such as Bitbucket or CodeCommit, use oauthToken.

You must specify either accessToken or oauthToken when you update an app.

Existing Amplify apps deployed from a GitHub repository using OAuth continue to work with CI/CD. However, we strongly recommend that you migrate these apps to use the GitHub App. For more information, see Migrating an existing OAuth app to the Amplify GitHub App in the Amplify User Guide .

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

autoBranchCreationConfig.documentation: The automated branch creation configuration for an Amplify app.

autoBranchCreationPatterns.documentation: Describes the automated branch creation glob patterns for an Amplify app.

basicAuthCredentials.documentation: The basic authorization credentials for an Amplify app. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

buildSpec.documentation: The build specification (build spec) for an Amplify app.

customHeaders.documentation: The custom HTTP headers for an Amplify app.

customRules.documentation: The custom redirect and rewrite rules for an Amplify app.

description.documentation: The description for an Amplify app.

enableAutoBranchCreation.documentation: Enables automated branch creation for an Amplify app.

enableBasicAuth.documentation: Enables basic authorization for an Amplify app.

enableBranchAutoBuild.documentation: Enables branch auto-building for an Amplify app.

enableBranchAutoDeletion.documentation: Automatically disconnects a branch in the Amplify Console when you delete a branch from your Git repository.

environmentVariables.documentation: The environment variables for an Amplify app.

iamServiceRoleArn.documentation: The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service role for an Amplify app.

name.documentation: The name for an Amplify app.

oauthToken.documentation:
The OAuth token for a third-party source control system for an Amplify app. The OAuth token is used to create a webhook and a read-only deploy key using SSH cloning. The OAuth token is not stored.

Use oauthToken for repository providers other than GitHub, such as Bitbucket or CodeCommit.

To authorize access to GitHub as your repository provider, use accessToken.

You must specify either oauthToken or accessToken when you update an app.

Existing Amplify apps deployed from a GitHub repository using OAuth continue to work with CI/CD. However, we strongly recommend that you migrate these apps to use the GitHub App. For more information, see Migrating an existing OAuth app to the Amplify GitHub App in the Amplify User Guide .

platform.documentation: The platform for an Amplify app.

repository.documentation: The name of the repository for an Amplify app

UpdateAppResult.documentation: The result structure for an Amplify app update request.

UpdateBranchRequest.documentation: The request structure for the update branch request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

backendEnvironmentArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a backend environment that is part of an Amplify app.

basicAuthCredentials.documentation: The basic authorization credentials for the branch. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

buildSpec.documentation: The build specification (build spec) for the branch.

displayName.documentation: The display name for a branch. This is used as the default domain prefix.

enableAutoBuild.documentation: Enables auto building for the branch.

enableBasicAuth.documentation: Enables basic authorization for the branch.

enablePerformanceMode.documentation:
Enables performance mode for the branch.

Performance mode optimizes for faster hosting performance by keeping content cached at the edge for a longer interval. When performance mode is enabled, hosting configuration or code changes can take up to 10 minutes to roll out.

enablePullRequestPreview.documentation: Enables pull request previews for this branch.

environmentVariables.documentation: The environment variables for the branch.

pullRequestEnvironmentName.documentation: The Amplify environment name for the pull request.

stage.documentation: Describes the current stage for the branch.

ttl.documentation: The content Time to Live (TTL) for the website in seconds.

UpdateBranchResult.documentation: The result structure for the update branch request.

branch.documentation: The branch for an Amplify app, which maps to a third-party repository branch.

UpdateDomainAssociationRequest.documentation: The request structure for the update domain association request.

appId.documentation: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

autoSubDomainCreationPatterns.documentation: Sets the branch patterns for automatic subdomain creation.

autoSubDomainIAMRole.documentation: The required AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service role for the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for automatically creating subdomains.

enableAutoSubDomain.documentation: Enables the automated creation of subdomains for branches.

subDomainSettings.documentation: Describes the settings for the subdomain.

UpdateDomainAssociationResult.documentation: The result structure for the update domain association request.

domainAssociation.documentation: Describes a domain association, which associates a custom domain with an Amplify app.

UpdateWebhookRequest.documentation: The request structure for the update webhook request.

branchName.documentation: The name for a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

webhookId.documentation: The unique ID for a webhook.

UpdateWebhookResult.documentation: The result structure for the update webhook request.

webhook.documentation: Describes a webhook that connects repository events to an Amplify app.

Webhook.documentation: Describes a webhook that connects repository events to an Amplify app.

branchName.documentation: The name for a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

createTime.documentation: The create date and time for a webhook.

updateTime.documentation: Updates the date and time for a webhook.

webhookArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the webhook.
